ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.activities

Class WeekPlanActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
          • ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.activities.WeekPlanActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatApi23.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback

    public class WeekPlanActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    This Activity is responsible for displaying the weekplan. In order to show all dates, and group planned recipes by date, I have decided to go for a nested RecyclerView layout as follows. WeekPlanLayout > Outer RecyclerView > CardView > InnerRecyclerView ">" means 'Contains' in this context. The CardView is never explicitly instantiated as Android doesn't require this.

      • sortDates

        private void sortDates()
        This is a bit of a round-about way of sorting the dates chronologically. Android does not support Java 8 Time Features, so JodaTime has to be used. The dates are stored in the database as Strings (in hindsight, perhaps not my best idea), are converted to a DateTime Object with the help of the DateTimeFormatter, added to a Collection and sorted, then converted back to strings in the original format and passed to the RecyclerView. It might not be pretty but it doesn't break.
